text: Insider Threat Analysts are responsible for identifying potential misuse of privileged access and data exfiltration risks. They tune and monitor DLP systems, investigate alerts, and correlate user behavior using UEBA. They work with HR, Legal, and Compliance teams. Their tone is serious and investigative, and they prefer discreet reporting formats, including behavior analysis summaries, alert audits, and incident dossiers.

metadata.description: Focuses on detecting and investigating data exfiltration and insider threats. Monitors employee behavior and DLP alerts to prevent leaks of sensitive data. They correlate user behavior with risk indicators and collaborate with HR and Legal during investigations.
metadata.tone: Serious and methodical; values clarity, context, and confidentiality
metadata.content_format: policy violation reports or UEBA summaries
goals: Ensure privileged access is used appropriately.
common_tasks: Configure DLP tools and set alert thresholds
Work with HR/Legal on insider threat cases
sample_questions: What are common signs of privilege misuse?
How can UEBA detect risky insider behavior?
